flawed_nl_solution:
Mrs. Fredrickson has 80 x 1/4 = <<80*1/4=320/1>>320/1 roosters.
So he has 80 - 320/1 = <<80-320/1=-240>>-240 hens.
Only -240 x 3/4 = <<-240*3/4=-180>>-180 of the hens lay eggs.
Thus, -240 - -180 = <<-240--180=-60>>-60 hens do not lay eggs.
Therefore, Mr. Fredrickson has a total of -60 hens + 320/1 roosters = <<-60+320/1=260>>260 chickens that do not lay eggs.
#### 260

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 320/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
